alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 5:57PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Franklin County through 645 PM CDT... At 556 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Red Bay, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Russellville, Belgreen, Pleasant Site, Pogo, Cedar Creek Reservoir, Dempsey, Isbell, Rockwood and Little Bear Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Alabama.
